items.name: a crystalline vial holding an ethereal red tarantula hawk wasp

raw: Fashioned from shiny crystal, the vial has a leather loop secured just below its lip to allow it to be attached to a belt.  A brownish solution fills the vial, suspending the ethereal red tarantula hawk wasp contained within.
Analysis of a crystalline vial holding an ethereal red tarantula hawk wasp indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The Creepy-Crawly Jar
This vial holds a preserved specimen.
It is currently Tier 3 of 3.
You can gaze, hug, lean, look, kiss, prod, pull, push, rub, shake, turn, twist, and whisper to the vial.

*This vial has been unlocked to allow a bug or sea creature (gem-type) to be PUSHed into the vial, temporarily overriding the custom creepy-crawly.  You can PULL the vial to revert it to its normal state.
Alterations:
* The 15/15/15 and long can be altered as long as it does not contradict the customizations or imply that the item is opaque.  The show cannot be altered.
* The noun can be changed, but it should retain the essence of something that is lidded or capped and made of glass (jar, bottle, tube, cylinder, etc).
* You may not use body parts from SPECIFIC sentient creatures-so no severed elf ears or hairy halfling toes, but severed ears and hairy toes are okay.

raw: The fine fabric of these gloves has an unusual sheen coating the surface.  Imbedded somehow within the weave of the fabric on the back of each hand is a large vaalin sigil.  The sigil has a slight opalescent cast reminiscent of vaalin, but the actual material remains a mystery.

Analysis of a pair of vaalin-sigiled silk gloves indicates the creator has provided the following information:

These gloves are made to be worn by pure magical professions.  They can be altered, but require the sigils to remain intact and the gloves should be made of fabric.  They also have a set show description that can't be removed, but more can be added to it.  The sigils are currently described as vaalin.  The sigils can be changed, but are limited to a 15 character descriptor.
You can tell that the gloves are as light as they can get, but you might be able to have a talented merchant deepen their pockets for you.
The vaalin-sigiled gloves will cost 149,999 coins.

Analysis of a banded coral snake indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a wearable, poseable snake.  When worn, it parks itself in your UNIQUE feature field.
This particular snake currently looks like this:
a banded coral snake

The snake's description can be altered by any merchant who feels comfortable doing so.  Remember: this snake must remain some form of non-legged, scale-having serpent.  It must be large enough in its natural form to encircle a being's waist, while not being so large that it makes no sense to twine around a forearm.  Any naturally occurring snake from the real world is fine, so long as the name doesn't violate any other GS Policy guidelines.  Dyes (as from the alchemy or cobbling systems) may not be used to make these snakes glow, shimmer, sparkle, or anything of the sort.
This coral snake is Tier 1, which is off the shelf level.  Verbs are: Mumble, Wear, Remove, and Rub.

These snakes are only able to be worn for a limited amount of time before they become too uncomfortable and slither down into your hands.  If you remove them manually before that point, you're fine, but if they get to the point of exhaustion, there will be a one hour cooldown while it rests up before it may be worn again.
This coral snake may be worn for about 25 minutes before becoming exhausted and entering cooldown mode.
The coral snake will cost 99,999 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 75,000 silvers.
It is predominantly crafted of organic material.
It has a permanently unlocked loresong by Xolanthe.

a coarse black roltalen canvas tent painted in grey wolf silhouettes

[Brodega's Tent]
The interior of the tent is pretty sparse.  Bits of sand and dirt are scattered across the ground.  The scent of mildew permeates the air.

The room interior can be altered to reference a placed lantern, bedroll, storage container, trash can, or scent.  If not referenced, additional sentences will be appended to display them.  There is a 511 character limit total on the room descriptions.  Any items not referenced will show in the room as "You also see...".  The items will not be linked in the room description; you can ANALYZE inside the tent to see the items that are placed there to interact with.

* One Pup Tent Storage Container: None.
PROD the tent flap to allow open access to the tent.

A glaes-bound blackened tsark tusk cannot store anything inside of it at all.
Analysis of a glaes-bound blackened tsark tusk indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The Ale Festival Drinking Horn
Designed to store liquid and will hold a maximum of 20 sips, though some special containers are offered that are unlimited.
Verb Traps: CLOSE, DRINK, MEASURE, OPEN, REMOVE, TURN, POUR*, WEAR
* POUR - This verb works one-way, allowing you to fill the tusk.
Unlocks:
Any dwarven merchant may unlock this item and any Ale Festival Merchant may as well.
Alterations:

The noun must remain horn or tusk.  The overall design must remain dwarven in nature.  Bandings, tips, and ornaments made of common dwarven materials like invar, mithril, and glaes, are encouraged in their descriptions.  Dwarves also like gems; feel free to adorn them with all types of gemstones found across Elanthia when altering these items.  Mundane and magical creatures alike throughout Elanthia can be used for the primary material of these drinking vessels as long as they have large enough horns or tusks to drink from.  (e.g. minotaur horn, ox horn, vor'taz horn, tsark tusk, boar tusk).
Customizations:

Lid/Cap option requires a noun (ie: lid, cap, cover).  Tip/end is the referencing point of the lid and can be either material or a gemstone.  Ornament can be a design that is carved into the side of the tusk and will always start with "the" in the areas it is displayed.  Strap/chain is referenced when wearing the tusk and should include a noun.  It will always be preceded by "the."  Clasp/buckle is referenced when wearing and removing the tusk.  It is the method by which the tusk is held in place.  It is always preceeded by "its" or "the."  When altering the solemn toast, capitalize the sentence and do not use punctuation.
Customization Fields:
Lid/Cap: obsidian lid
Tip/End: glaes-bound end
Ornament: dwarven emblem
Strap/Chain: strap
Clasp/buckle: clasp
Solemn Toast: To kin and kegs.
Cheerful Toast: (ONLY VISIBLE WITH UNLOCK) - May your barrels never run dry!
Special Dwarven Abilities:
* Ability to drink from the tusk while it is worn.
A glaes-bound blackened tsark tusk is tier 1 of 2 tiers.
The blackened tsark tusk will cost 150,000 coins.

raw: A steel-bound dark minotaur horn cannot store anything inside of it at all.
Analysis of a steel-bound dark minotaur horn indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The Ale Festival Drinking Horn
Designed to store liquid and will hold a maximum of 20 sips, though some special containers are offered that are unlimited.
Verb Traps: CLOSE, DRINK, MEASURE, OPEN, REMOVE, TURN, POUR*, WEAR
* POUR - This verb works one-way, allowing you to fill the horn.
Unlocks:
Any dwarven merchant may unlock this item and any Ale Festival Merchant may as well.
Alterations:

The noun must remain horn or tusk.  The overall design must remain dwarven in nature.  Bandings, tips, and ornaments made of common dwarven materials like invar, mithril, and glaes, are encouraged in their descriptions.  Dwarves also like gems; feel free to adorn them with all types of gemstones found across Elanthia when altering these items.  Mundane and magical creatures alike throughout Elanthia can be used for the primary material of these drinking vessels as long as they have large enough horns or tusks to drink from.  (e.g. minotaur horn, ox horn, vor'taz horn, tsark tusk, boar tusk).
Customizations:

Lid/Cap option requires a noun (ie: lid, cap, cover).  Tip/end is the referencing point of the lid and can be either material or a gemstone.  Ornament can be a design that is carved into the side of the horn and will always start with "the" in the areas it is displayed.  Strap/chain is referenced when wearing the horn and should include a noun.  It will always be preceded by "the."  Clasp/buckle is referenced when wearing and removing the horn.  It is the method by which the horn is held in place.  It is always preceeded by "its" or "the."  When altering the solemn toast, capitalize the sentence and do not use punctuation.
Customization Fields:
Lid/Cap: onyx lid
Tip/End: steel-bound end
Ornament: dwarven emblem
Strap/Chain: strap
Clasp/buckle: clasp
Solemn Toast: To kin and kegs.
Cheerful Toast: (ONLY VISIBLE WITH UNLOCK) - May your barrels never run dry!
Special Dwarven Abilities:
* Ability to drink from the horn while it is worn.
A steel-bound dark minotaur horn is tier 1 of 2 tiers.
The dark minotaur horn will cost 150,000 coins.
